page.title: 04Ecology of the Area
page.content: There is a wide variety of wild plants, animals and birds. The{rabbit} and{pigeon}population has reached a very high level, possibly due to the good harvest of 1984. More unusual animals are{roe deer}and{ferrel mink,} the latter having escaped from a local mink farm. These, to-gether with ducks swans, heron, water rats and water fowl are dependent on the Adur. River dredging has reduced the semi-aquatic habitat but has reduced the incidence of{field flooding}when excess run-off from the urban developments of Haywards Heath and Burgess Hill coincide with high levels in the tidal portion of the river. The influence of modern{insecticides and{fertilizers}is not known, but recent precautionary trends have pro- hibited farming use close to hedgerows and woodlands.
